metadata.dc:author: Armengol Carrasco, Manuel
Arbós Vía, María Antonia
López Cano, Manuel
Quiles Pérez, María Teresa
metadata.dc:description: Permanent synthetic materials are currently of choice for abdominal wall hernia repair. However, they are not ideal as short- and long-term complications with these have been reported. Extracellular matrix-derived biological implants (EMDBI) have emerged as a result of research and development into new materials. Several types of EMDBI have appeared in the last few years, each with its own manufacture characteristics and different from the rest. The current panorama of the xenogeneic EMDBI available in Spain is analysed, their complications, the unknown factors arising in the long-term, and the clinical experience available on incisional and inguinal hernias.
metadata.dc:title: Implantes biológicos en la cirugía de las hernias de la pared abdominal.
[Biological implants in abdominal wall hernia surgery].
